title: Sands of time
caption: Sands of time
desc: At first glance, you might mistake these dunes for massive snowdrifts. Although you can sledge down them, the tiny crystals that make up White Sands National Monument in New Mexico, USA are not ice but gypsum, a soft mineral often used to make plaster and chalk. The pearly sands compose the largest gypsum dune field in the world but cover just a fraction of southern New Mexico's Tularosa Basin.
